meanings.definition: Increase or rise suddenly and strongly.
meanings.sent1: The excitement upsurged within me when I saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The number of visitors upsurged at the museum after the new exhibit opened.
meanings.sent3: The laughter upsurged from the audience as the comedian told a joke.
meanings.sent4: Hope upsurged in her heart as she received encouraging news.
meanings.sent5: The music upsurged in intensity, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A sudden strong increase or rise.
meanings.sent1: The upsurge in sales during the holiday season was a welcome boost for the company.
meanings.sent2: There was an upsurge of interest in gardening during the lockdown.
meanings.sent3: The upsurge of balloons at the party created a colorful spectacle.
meanings.sent4: An upsurge of energy propelled him to finish the race strong.
meanings.sent5: The upsurge of applause filled the concert hall after the performance.
